article.title: The Structure of Scientific LiteraturesI: Identifying and Graphing Specialities
article.author: Small, H.Griffith, B.C.
article.text: In this paper we report a first experiment using a new computer-based technique to identify clusters of highly interactive documents in science. We contend that these clusters represent the scientific specialties which currently exhibit high levels of activity. This technique, we believe, opens the way to a systematic exploration of the entire specialty structure of science, including both the internal structure of specialities and their relationship to one another.
